name: Dumbbell Farmer's Carry
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and a pair of dumbbells resting on the floor beside your feet.

2. Squat down to pick up the dumbbells, ensuring to keep your back straight and chest up. Grip each dumbbell firmly in your hands.

3. Stand up fully, engaging your core and glutes, so you are standing straight with the dumbbells at your sides, arms fully extended.

4. Maintain a neutral spine and keep your shoulders level. Avoid shrugging them up towards your ears.

5. Begin walking forward, making sure to keep your steps controlled and even. Keep your core tight throughout the movement to prevent any side-to-side swaying.

6. Walk for a specific distance or time, aiming to maintain good posture and control throughout.

7. Once you've completed the set distance or time, stop and set the dumbbells down carefully, maintaining good form.
short_summary: The Dumbbell Farmer's Carry is a full-body exercise that involves walking while holding weights at your sides. It primarily targets the shoulders, core, and grip strength.
